     115           20 : static void nl80211_register_eloop_read(struct nl_sock **handle,
     116              :                                         eloop_sock_handler handler,
     117              :                                         void *eloop_data, int persist)
     118              : {
     119              :         /*
     120              :          * libnl uses a pretty small buffer (32 kB that gets converted to 64 kB)
     121              :          * by default. It is possible to hit that limit in some cases where
     122              :          * operations are blocked, e.g., with a burst of Deauthentication frames
     123              :          * to hostapd and STA entry deletion. Try to increase the buffer to make
     124              :          * this less likely to occur.
     125              :          */
     126              :         int err;
     127              : 
     128           20 :         err = nl_socket_set_buffer_size(*handle, 262144, 0);
     129           20 :         if (err < 0) {
     130            0 :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
     131              :                            "nl80211: Could not set nl_socket RX buffer size: %s",
     132              :                            nl_geterror(err));
     133              :                 /* continue anyway with the default (smaller) buffer */
     134              :         }
     135              : 
     136           20 :         nl_socket_set_nonblocking(*handle);
     137           20 :         eloop_register_read_sock(nl_socket_get_fd(*handle), handler,
     138              :                                  eloop_data, *handle);
     139           20 :         if (!persist)
     140           15 :                 *handle = (void *) (((intptr_t) *handle) ^
     141              :                                     ELOOP_SOCKET_INVALID);
     142           20 : }
     143              : 
     144              : 
     145           20 : static void nl80211_destroy_eloop_handle(struct nl_sock **handle, int persist)

     370              :         /*
     371              :          * Clear nlmsg data, e.g., to make sure key material is not left in
     372              :          * heap memory for unnecessarily long time.

     375         1353 :                 struct nlmsghdr *hdr = nlmsg_hdr(msg);

     381              :                  * here.

     435              : 
     436            0 :                 ext_arg->err = &err;

     438              :                           ack_handler_custom, ack_data);

     443         1333 :         if (valid_handler)
     444          346 :                 nl_cb_set(cb, NL_CB_VALID, NL_CB_CUSTOM,
     445              :                           valid_handler, valid_data);
     446              : 
     447         2997 :         while (err > 0) {
     448         1664 :                 int res = nl_recvmsgs(nl_handle, cb);
     449              : 
     450         1664 :                 if (res == -NLE_DUMP_INTR) {
     451              :                         /* Most likely one of the nl80211 dump routines hit a
     452              :                          * case where internal results changed while the dump
     453              :                          * was being sent. The most common known case for this
     454              :                          * is scan results fetching while associated were every
     455              :                          * received Beacon frame from the AP may end up
     456              :                          * incrementing bss_generation. This
     457              :                          * NL80211_CMD_GET_SCAN case tries again in the caller;
     458              :                          * other cases (of which there are no known common ones)
     459              :                          * will stop and return an error. */
     460            0 :                         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: %s; convert to -EAGAIN",
     461              :                                    nl_geterror(res));
     462            0 :                         err = -EAGAIN;
     463         1664 :                 } else if (res < 0) {
     464            0 :                         wpa_printf(MSG_INFO,
     465              :                                    "nl80211: %s->nl_recvmsgs failed: %d (%s)",
     466              :                                    __func__, res, nl_geterror(res));
     467              :                 }
     468              :         }
     469         1333 :  out:
     470         1333 :         nl_cb_put(cb);
     471              :         /* Always clear the message as it can potentially contain keys */
     472         1333 :         nl80211_nlmsg_clear(msg);
     473         1333 :         nlmsg_free(msg);
     474         1333 :         return err;
     475              : }

     489              : 
     490              : 
     491              : /* Use this method to mark that it is necessary to own the connection/interface
     492              :  * for this operation.
     493              :  * handle may be set to NULL, to get the same behavior as send_and_recv_msgs().
     494              :  * set_owner can be used to mark this socket for receiving control port frames.
     495              :  */
     496            5 : static int send_and_recv_msgs_owner(struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv,
     497              :                                     struct nl_msg *msg,
     498              :                                     struct nl_sock *handle, int set_owner,
     499              :                                     int (*valid_handler)(struct nl_msg *,
     500              :                                                          void *),
     501              :                                     void *valid_data,
     502              :                                     int (*ack_handler_custom)(struct nl_msg *,
     503              :                                                               void *),
     504              :                                     void *ack_data)
     505              : {
     506            5 :         if (!msg)
     507            0 :                 return -ENOMEM;
     508              : 
     509              :         /* Control port over nl80211 needs the flags and attributes below.
     510              :          *
     511              :          * The Linux kernel has initial checks for them (in nl80211.c) like:
     512              :          *     validate_pae_over_nl80211(...)
     513              :          * or final checks like:
     514              :          *     dev->ieee80211_ptr->conn_owner_nlportid != info->snd_portid
     515              :          *
     516              :          * Final operations (e.g., disassociate) don't need to set these
     517              :          * attributes, but they have to be performed on the socket, which has
     518              :          * the connection owner property set in the kernel.
     519              :          */
     520            5 :         if ((drv->capa.flags2 & WPA_DRIVER_FLAGS2_CONTROL_PORT_RX) &&
     521           10 :             handle && set_owner &&
     522           10 :             (nla_put_flag(msg, NL80211_ATTR_CONTROL_PORT_OVER_NL80211) ||
     523           10 :              nla_put_flag(msg, NL80211_ATTR_SOCKET_OWNER) ||
     524           10 :              nla_put_u16(msg, NL80211_ATTR_CONTROL_PORT_ETHERTYPE, ETH_P_PAE) ||
     525            5 :              nla_put_flag(msg, NL80211_ATTR_CONTROL_PORT_NO_PREAUTH)))
     526            0 :                 return -1;
     527              : 
     528            5 :         return send_and_recv(drv->global, handle ? handle : drv->global->nl,
     529              :                              msg, valid_handler, valid_data,
     530              :                              ack_handler_custom, ack_data);
     531              : }
     532              : 
     533              :

     537              :                                   int set_owner)
     538              : {

    1014          655 : static void wpa_driver_nl80211_event_newlink(
    1015              :         struct nl80211_global *global, struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv,

    1444              :                 [NL80211_BSS_BSSID] = { .type = NLA_UNSPEC },
    1445              :                 [NL80211_BSS_FREQUENCY] = { .type = NLA_U32 },

    1447              :                 [NL80211_BSS_STATUS] = { .type = NLA_U32 },

    2021            0 : static void wpa_driver_nl80211_handle_eapol_tx_status(int sock,
    2022              :                                                       void *eloop_ctx,
    2023              :                                                       void *handle)
    2024              : {
    2025            0 :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = eloop_ctx;
    2026              :         u8 data[2048];
    2027              :         struct msghdr msg;
    2028              :         struct iovec entry;
    2029              :         u8 control[512];
    2030              :         struct cmsghdr *cmsg;
    2031            0 :         int res, found_ee = 0, found_wifi = 0, acked = 0;
    2032              :         union wpa_event_data event;
    2033              : 
    2034            0 :         memset(&msg, 0, sizeof(msg));
    2035            0 :         msg.msg_iov = &entry;
    2036            0 :         msg.msg_iovlen = 1;
    2037            0 :         entry.iov_base = data;
    2038            0 :         entry.iov_len = sizeof(data);
    2039            0 :         msg.msg_control = &control;
    2040            0 :         msg.msg_controllen = sizeof(control);
    2041              : 
    2042            0 :         res = recvmsg(sock, &msg, MSG_ERRQUEUE);
    2043              :         /* if error or not fitting 802.3 header, return */
    2044            0 :         if (res < 14)
    2045            0 :                 return;
    2046              : 
    2047            0 :         for (cmsg = CMSG_FIRSTHDR(&msg); cmsg; cmsg = CMSG_NXTHDR(&msg, cmsg))
    2048              :         {
    2049            0 :                 if (cmsg->cmsg_level == SOL_SOCKET &&
    2050            0 :                     cmsg->cmsg_type == SCM_WIFI_STATUS) {
    2051              :                         int *ack;
    2052              : 
    2053            0 :                         found_wifi = 1;
    2054            0 :                         ack = (void *)CMSG_DATA(cmsg);
    2055            0 :                         acked = *ack;
    2056              :                 }
    2057              : 
    2058            0 :                 if (cmsg->cmsg_level == SOL_PACKET &&
    2059            0 :                     cmsg->cmsg_type == PACKET_TX_TIMESTAMP) {
    2060            0 :                         struct sock_extended_err *err =
    2061              :                                 (struct sock_extended_err *)CMSG_DATA(cmsg);
    2062              : 
    2063            0 :                         if (err->ee_origin == SO_EE_ORIGIN_TXSTATUS)
    2064            0 :                                 found_ee = 1;
    2065              :                 }
    2066              :         }
    2067              : 
    2068            0 :         if (!found_ee || !found_wifi)
    2069            0 :                 return;
    2070              : 
    2071            0 :         memset(&event, 0, sizeof(event));
    2072            0 :         event.eapol_tx_status.dst = data;
    2073            0 :         event.eapol_tx_status.data = data + 14;
    2074            0 :         event.eapol_tx_status.data_len = res - 14;
    2075            0 :         event.eapol_tx_status.ack = acked;
    2076            0 :         wpa_supplicant_event(drv->ctx, EVENT_EAPOL_TX_STATUS, &event);

    2769              : #ifdef CONFIG_TESTING_OPTIONS
    2770              : static int qca_vendor_test_cmd_handler(struct nl_msg *msg, void *arg)
    2771              : {
    2772              :         /* struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = arg; */
    2773              :         struct nlattr *tb[NL80211_ATTR_MAX + 1];
    2774              :         struct genlmsghdr *gnlh = nlmsg_data(nlmsg_hdr(msg));
    2775              : 
    2776              : 
    2777              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
    2778              :                    "nl80211: QCA vendor test command response received");
    2779              : 
    2780              :         nla_parse(tb, NL80211_ATTR_MAX, genlmsg_attrdata(gnlh, 0),
    2781              :                   genlmsg_attrlen(gnlh, 0), NULL);
    2782              :         if (!tb[NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA]) {
    2783              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: No vendor data attribute");
    2784              :                 return NL_SKIP;
    2785              :         }
    2786              : 
    2787              :         wpa_hexdump(MSG_DEBUG,
    2788              :                     "nl80211: Received QCA vendor test command response",
    2789              :                     nla_data(tb[NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA]),
    2790              :                     nla_len(tb[NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA]));
    2791              : 
    2792              :         return NL_SKIP;
    2793              : }
    2794              : #endif /* CONFIG_TESTING_OPTIONS */
    2795              : 
    2796              : 
    2797            5 : static void qca_vendor_test(struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv)
    2798              : {
    2799              : #ifdef CONFIG_TESTING_OPTIONS
    2800              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
    2801              :         struct nlattr *params;
    2802              :         int ret;
    2803              : 
    2804              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_VENDOR)) ||
    2805              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_ID, OUI_QCA) ||
    2806              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_SUBCMD,
    2807              :                         QCA_NL80211_VENDOR_SUBCMD_TEST) ||
    2808              :             !(params = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA)) ||
    2809              :             nla_put_u32(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_TEST, 123)) {
    2810              :                 nlmsg_free(msg);
    2811              :                 return;
    2812              :         }
    2813              :         nla_nest_end(msg, params);
    2814              :

    3132            5 : static int wpa_cipher_to_cipher_suites(unsigned int ciphers, u32 suites[],
    3133              :                                        int max_suites)
    3134              : {
    3135            5 :         int num_suites = 0;
    3136              :

    3140            0 :                 suites[num_suites++] = RSN_CIPHER_SUITE_GCMP_256;
    3141            5 :         if (num_suites < max_suites && ciphers & WPA_CIPHER_CCMP)
    3142            5 :                 suites[num_suites++] = RSN_CIPHER_SUITE_CCMP;
    3143            5 :         if (num_suites < max_suites && ciphers & WPA_CIPHER_GCMP)
    3144            0 :                 suites[num_suites++] = RSN_CIPHER_SUITE_GCMP;

    3156            5 : static int wpa_key_mgmt_to_suites(unsigned int key_mgmt_suites, u32 suites[],
    3157              :                                   int max_suites)
    3158              : {
    3159            5 :         int num_suites = 0;
    3160              : 
    3161              : #define __AKM(a, b) \
    3162              :         if (num_suites < max_suites && \
    3163              :             (key_mgmt_suites & (WPA_KEY_MGMT_ ## a))) \
    3164              :                 suites[num_suites++] = (RSN_AUTH_KEY_MGMT_ ## b)
    3165            5 :         __AKM(IEEE8021X, UNSPEC_802_1X);
    3166            5 :         __AKM(PSK, PSK_OVER_802_1X);
    3167            5 :         __AKM(FT_IEEE8021X, FT_802_1X);
    3168            5 :         __AKM(FT_PSK, FT_PSK);
    3169            5 :         __AKM(IEEE8021X_SHA256, 802_1X_SHA256);
    3170            5 :         __AKM(PSK_SHA256, PSK_SHA256);
    3171            5 :         __AKM(SAE, SAE);
    3172            5 :         __AKM(FT_SAE, FT_SAE);
    3173            5 :         __AKM(CCKM, CCKM);
    3174            5 :         __AKM(OSEN, OSEN);
    3175            5 :         __AKM(IEEE8021X_SUITE_B, 802_1X_SUITE_B);
    3176            5 :         __AKM(IEEE8021X_SUITE_B_192, 802_1X_SUITE_B_192);
    3177            5 :         __AKM(FILS_SHA256, FILS_SHA256);
    3178            5 :         __AKM(FILS_SHA384, FILS_SHA384);
    3179            5 :         __AKM(FT_FILS_SHA256, FT_FILS_SHA256);
    3180            5 :         __AKM(FT_FILS_SHA384, FT_FILS_SHA384);
    3181            5 :         __AKM(OWE, OWE);
    3182            5 :         __AKM(DPP, DPP);
    3183            5 :         __AKM(FT_IEEE8021X_SHA384, FT_802_1X_SHA384);
    3184              : #undef __AKM
    3185              : 
    3186            5 :         return num_suites;
    3187              : }

    3221            0 : static int nl80211_set_pmk(struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv,
    3222              :                            const u8 *key, size_t key_len,
    3223              :                            const u8 *addr)
    3224              : {
    3225            0 :         struct nl_msg *msg = NULL;
    3226              :         int ret;
    3227              : 
    3228              :         /*
    3229              :          * If the authenticator address is not set, assume it is
    3230              :          * the current BSSID.
    3231              :          */
    3232            0 :         if (!addr && drv->associated)
    3233            0 :                 addr = drv->bssid;
    3234            0 :         else if (!addr)
    3235            0 :                 return -1;
    3236              : 
    3237            0 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: Set PMK to the driver for " MACSTR,
    3238            0 :                    MAC2STR(addr));
    3239            0 :         wpa_hexdump_key(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: PMK", key, key_len);

    3666            0 : static void nl80211_copy_auth_params(struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv,
    3667              :                                      struct wpa_driver_auth_params *params)
    3668              : {

    3670              :

    3673            0 :         drv->auth_wep_tx_keyidx = params->wep_tx_keyidx;
    3674            0 :         drv->auth_local_state_change = params->local_state_change;
    3675            0 :         drv->auth_p2p = params->p2p;
    3676              :

    3678            0 :                 os_memcpy(drv->auth_bssid_, params->bssid, ETH_ALEN);

    3681              :

    3722            0 : static void nl80211_unmask_11b_rates(struct i802_bss *bss)
    3723              : {
    3724            0 :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
    3725              :

    3727            0 :                 return;

    3729              :         /*

    3731              :          * happen, e.g., if the interface was down at the point in time when a
    3732              :          * P2P group was terminated.
    3733              :          */

    3736            0 :                    bss->ifname);

    3743            0 :         if (wpa_auth_alg & WPA_AUTH_ALG_OPEN)
    3744            0 :                 return NL80211_AUTHTYPE_OPEN_SYSTEM;

    3746            0 :                 return NL80211_AUTHTYPE_SHARED_KEY;
    3747            0 :         if (wpa_auth_alg & WPA_AUTH_ALG_LEAP)
    3748            0 :                 return NL80211_AUTHTYPE_NETWORK_EAP;
    3749            0 :         if (wpa_auth_alg & WPA_AUTH_ALG_FT)
    3750            0 :                 return NL80211_AUTHTYPE_FT;
    3751            0 :         if (wpa_auth_alg & WPA_AUTH_ALG_SAE)
    3752            0 :                 return NL80211_AUTHTYPE_SAE;
    3753            0 :         if (wpa_auth_alg & WPA_AUTH_ALG_FILS)
    3754            0 :                 return NL80211_AUTHTYPE_FILS_SK;

    3756            0 :                 return NL80211_AUTHTYPE_FILS_SK_PFS;
    3757              : 
    3758            0 :         return NL80211_AUTHTYPE_MAX;

    3978          247 : static int wpa_driver_nl80211_send_mlme(struct i802_bss *bss, const u8 *data,
    3979              :                                         size_t data_len, int noack,
    3980              :                                         unsigned int freq, int no_cck,
    3981              :                                         int offchanok,

    3983              :                                         const u16 *csa_offs,

    4900              : 
    4901            5 : static int nl80211_put_freq_params(struct nl_msg *msg,
    4902              :                                    const struct hostapd_freq_params *freq)
    4903              : {

    4907              : 
    4908            5 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "  * freq=%d", freq->freq);
    4909            5 :         if (nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_WIPHY_FREQ, freq->freq))
    4910            0 :                 return -ENOBUFS;
    4911              : 
    4912            5 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "  * eht_enabled=%d", freq->eht_enabled);
    4913            5 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "  * he_enabled=%d", freq->he_enabled);
    4914            5 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "  * vht_enabled=%d", freq->vht_enabled);
    4915            5 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "  * ht_enabled=%d", freq->ht_enabled);
    4916            5 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "  * radar_background=%d",
    4917            5 :                    freq->radar_background);
    4918              : 
    4919            5 :         hw_mode = ieee80211_freq_to_chan(freq->freq, &channel);
    4920            5 :         is_24ghz = hw_mode == HOSTAPD_MODE_IEEE80211G ||
    4921              :                 hw_mode == HOSTAPD_MODE_IEEE80211B;
    4922              : 
    4923            5 :         if (freq->vht_enabled ||
    4924            5 :             ((freq->he_enabled || freq->eht_enabled) && !is_24ghz)) {
    4925              :                 enum nl80211_chan_width cw;
    4926              : 
    4927            0 :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "  * bandwidth=%d", freq->bandwidth);
    4928            0 :                 switch (freq->bandwidth) {
    4929            0 :                 case 20:
    4930            0 :                         cw = NL80211_CHAN_WIDTH_20;
    4931            0 :                         break;
    4932            0 :                 case 40:
    4933            0 :                         cw = NL80211_CHAN_WIDTH_40;
    4934            0 :                         break;
    4935            0 :                 case 80:
    4936            0 :                         if (freq->center_freq2)
    4937            0 :                                 cw = NL80211_CHAN_WIDTH_80P80;
    4938              :                         else
    4939            0 :                                 cw = NL80211_CHAN_WIDTH_80;
    4940            0 :                         break;
    4941            0 :                 case 160:
    4942            0 :                         cw = NL80211_CHAN_WIDTH_160;
    4943            0 :                         break;
    4944            0 :                 default:
    4945            0 :                         return -EINVAL;
    4946              :                 }
    4947              : 
    4948            0 :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "  * channel_width=%d", cw);

    4950            0 :                            freq->center_freq1);

    5035          738 : static u32 sta_flags_nl80211(int flags)

    5069              :                 return NL80211_PLINK_CNF_RCVD;
    5070              :         case PLINK_ESTAB:
    5071              :                 return NL80211_PLINK_ESTAB;
    5072              :         case PLINK_HOLDING:
    5073              :                 return NL80211_PLINK_HOLDING;

    5075              :                 return NL80211_PLINK_BLOCKED;

    5260              :          * station is added in unauthenticated state, set the
    5261              :          * authenticated/associated bits in the mask to prevent moving this
    5262              :          * station to associated state before it is actually associated.
    5263              :          *

    5334            0 : static void rtnl_neigh_delete_fdb_entry(struct i802_bss *bss, const u8 *addr)

    5336              : #ifdef CONFIG_LIBNL3_ROUTE
    5337              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
    5338              :         struct rtnl_neigh *rn;
    5339              :         struct nl_addr *nl_addr;
    5340              :         int err;
    5341              : 
    5342              :         rn = rtnl_neigh_alloc();
    5343              :         if (!rn)
    5344              :                 return;
    5345              : 
    5346              :         rtnl_neigh_set_family(rn, AF_BRIDGE);
    5347              :         rtnl_neigh_set_ifindex(rn, bss->ifindex);
    5348              :         nl_addr = nl_addr_build(AF_BRIDGE, (void *) addr, ETH_ALEN);
    5349              :         if (!nl_addr) {
    5350              :                 rtnl_neigh_put(rn);
    5351              :                 return;
    5352              :         }
    5353              :         rtnl_neigh_set_lladdr(rn, nl_addr);
    5354              :

    5358              :                            MACSTR " ifindex=%d failed: %s", MAC2STR(addr),
    5359              :                            bss->ifindex, nl_geterror(err));

    5362              :                            MACSTR, MAC2STR(addr));
    5363              :         }
    5364              : 
    5365              :         nl_addr_put(nl_addr);

    5368            0 : }

    5371          455 : static int wpa_driver_nl80211_sta_remove(struct i802_bss *bss, const u8 *addr,
    5372              :                                          int deauth, u16 reason_code)
    5373              : {
    5374          455 :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
    5375              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
    5376              :         int ret;
    5377              : 
    5378          910 :         if (!(msg = nl80211_bss_msg(bss, 0, NL80211_CMD_DEL_STATION)) ||
    5379          910 :             nla_put(msg, NL80211_ATTR_MAC, ETH_ALEN, addr) ||
    5380            0 :             (deauth == 0 &&
    5381            0 :              nla_put_u8(msg, NL80211_ATTR_MGMT_SUBTYPE,
    5382          455 :                         WLAN_FC_STYPE_DISASSOC)) ||
    5383            0 :             (deauth == 1 &&
    5384            0 :              nla_put_u8(msg, NL80211_ATTR_MGMT_SUBTYPE,
    5385          455 :                         WLAN_FC_STYPE_DEAUTH)) ||
    5386            0 :             (reason_code &&
    5387            0 :              nla_put_u16(msg, NL80211_ATTR_REASON_CODE, reason_code))) {
    5388            0 :                 nlmsg_free(msg);
    5389            0 :                 return -ENOBUFS;
    5390              :         }
    5391              :

    5735            0 : static int wpa_driver_nl80211_hapd_send_eapol(

    6631            6 : static int wpa_driver_nl80211_set_mode_impl(
    6632              :                 struct i802_bss *bss,
    6633              :                 enum nl80211_iftype nlmode,
    6634              :                 struct hostapd_freq_params *desired_freq_params)
    6635              : {
    6636            6 :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
    6637            6 :         int ret = -1;
    6638              :         int i;
    6639            6 :         int was_ap = is_ap_interface(drv->nlmode);
    6640              :         int res;
    6641              :         int mode_switch_res;
    6642              : 
    6643              :         if (TEST_FAIL())

    6648            0 :                 mode_switch_res = 0;
    6649              : 
    6650            6 :         if (mode_switch_res == 0) {
    6651            4 :                 drv->nlmode = nlmode;
    6652            4 :                 ret = 0;
    6653            4 :                 goto done;
    6654              :         }
    6655              : 
    6656            2 :         if (mode_switch_res == -ENODEV)
    6657            0 :                 return -1;
    6658              : 
    6659            2 :         if (nlmode == drv->nlmode) {
    6660            0 :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: Interface already in "
    6661              :                            "requested mode - ignore error");
    6662            0 :                 ret = 0;
    6663            0 :                 goto done; /* Already in the requested mode */
    6664              :         }
    6665              : 
    6666              :         /* mac80211 doesn't allow mode changes while the device is up, so
    6667              :          * take the device down, try to set the mode again, and bring the
    6668              :          * device back up.
    6669              :          */
    6670            2 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: Try mode change after setting "
    6671              :                    "interface down");
    6672            2 :         for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    6673            2 :                 res = i802_set_iface_flags(bss, 0);
    6674            2 :                 if (res == -EACCES || res == -ENODEV)
    6675              :                         break;

    6678              :                                    "interface down");

    6680            0 :                         continue;
    6681              :                 }
    6682              : 
    6683              :                 /*
    6684              :                  * Setting the mode will fail for some drivers if the phy is
    6685              :                  * on a frequency that the mode is disallowed in.
    6686              :                  */

    6688            0 :                         res = nl80211_set_channel(bss, desired_freq_params, 0);
    6689            0 :                         if (res) {
    6690            0 :                                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
    6691              :                                            "nl80211: Failed to set frequency on interface");
    6692              :                         }
    6693              :                 }
    6694              :

    6697            0 :                     (bss->added_if_into_bridge || bss->already_in_bridge)) {

    6702            0 :                                             bss->brname, bss->ifname) < 0)

    8128          247 : static int cookie_handler(struct nl_msg *msg, void *arg)
    8129              : {
    8130              :         struct nlattr *tb[NL80211_ATTR_MAX + 1];

    8134              :                   genlmsg_attrlen(gnlh, 0), NULL);
    8135          247 :         if (tb[NL80211_ATTR_COOKIE])
    8136          247 :                 *cookie = nla_get_u64(tb[NL80211_ATTR_COOKIE]);
    8137          247 :         return NL_SKIP;
    8138              : }

    8141          247 : static int nl80211_send_frame_cmd(struct i802_bss *bss,

    8326              :          * the driver may keep a list of all pending offchannel TX operations

    9317              : 
    9318              : static int nl80211_tdls_oper(void *priv, enum tdls_oper oper, const u8 *peer)
    9319              : {
    9320              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
    9321              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
    9322              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
    9323              :         enum nl80211_tdls_operation nl80211_oper;
    9324              :         int res;
    9325              : 
    9326              :         if (!(drv->capa.flags & WPA_DRIVER_FLAGS_TDLS_SUPPORT))
    9327              :                 return -EOPNOTSUPP;
    9328              : 
    9329              :         switch (oper) {
    9330              :         case TDLS_DISCOVERY_REQ:
    9331              :                 nl80211_oper = NL80211_TDLS_DISCOVERY_REQ;
    9332              :                 break;
    9333              :         case TDLS_SETUP:
    9334              :                 nl80211_oper = NL80211_TDLS_SETUP;
    9335              :                 break;
    9336              :         case TDLS_TEARDOWN:
    9337              :                 nl80211_oper = NL80211_TDLS_TEARDOWN;
    9338              :                 break;
    9339              :         case TDLS_ENABLE_LINK:
    9340              :                 nl80211_oper = NL80211_TDLS_ENABLE_LINK;
    9341              :                 break;
    9342              :         case TDLS_DISABLE_LINK:
    9343              :                 nl80211_oper = NL80211_TDLS_DISABLE_LINK;
    9344              :                 break;
    9345              :         case TDLS_ENABLE:
    9346              :                 return 0;
    9347              :         case TDLS_DISABLE:
    9348              :                 return 0;
    9349              :         default:
    9350              :                 return -EINVAL;
    9351              :         }
    9352              : 
    9353              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_TDLS_OPER)) ||
    9354              :             nla_put_u8(msg, NL80211_ATTR_TDLS_OPERATION, nl80211_oper) ||
    9355              :             nla_put(msg, NL80211_ATTR_MAC, ETH_ALEN, peer)) {
    9356              :                 nlmsg_free(msg);
    9357              :                 return -ENOBUFS;
    9358              :         }
    9359              : 
    9360              :         res = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
    9361              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: TDLS_OPER: oper=%d mac=" MACSTR
    9362              :                    " --> res=%d (%s)", nl80211_oper, MAC2STR(peer), res,
    9363              :                    strerror(-res));
    9364              :         return res;
    9365              : }

    9441              : 
    9442              :         /*
    9443              :          * Do a vendor specific scan if possible. If only_new_results is
    9444              :          * set, do a normal scan since a kernel (cfg80211) BSS cache flush
    9445              :          * cannot be achieved through a vendor scan. The below condition may
    9446              :          * need to be modified if new scan flags are added in the future whose

   10582              : 
   10583              : 
   10584              : static int nl80211_put_mesh_config(struct nl_msg *msg,
   10585              :                                    struct wpa_driver_mesh_bss_params *params)
   10586              : {
   10587              :         struct nlattr *container;
   10588              : 
   10589              :         container = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_MESH_CONFIG);
   10590              :         if (!container)
   10591              :                 return -1;
   10592              : 
   10593              :         if (((params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_CONF_FLAG_AUTO_PLINKS) &&
   10594              :              nla_put_u8(msg, NL80211_MESHCONF_AUTO_OPEN_PLINKS,
   10595              :                         params->auto_plinks)) ||
   10596              :             ((params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_CONF_FLAG_FORWARDING) &&
   10597              :              nla_put_u8(msg, NL80211_MESHCONF_FORWARDING,
   10598              :                         params->forwarding)) ||
   10599              :             ((params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_CONF_FLAG_MAX_PEER_LINKS) &&
   10600              :              nla_put_u16(msg, NL80211_MESHCONF_MAX_PEER_LINKS,
   10601              :                          params->max_peer_links)) ||
   10602              :             ((params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_CONF_FLAG_RSSI_THRESHOLD) &&
   10603              :              nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_MESHCONF_RSSI_THRESHOLD,
   10604              :                          params->rssi_threshold)))
   10605              :                 return -1;
   10606              : 
   10607              :         /*
   10608              :          * Set NL80211_MESHCONF_PLINK_TIMEOUT even if user mpm is used because
   10609              :          * the timer could disconnect stations even in that case.
   10610              :          */
   10611              :         if ((params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_CONF_FLAG_PEER_LINK_TIMEOUT) &&
   10612              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_MESHCONF_PLINK_TIMEOUT,
   10613              :                         params->peer_link_timeout)) {
   10614              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR, "nl80211: Failed to set PLINK_TIMEOUT");
   10615              :                 return -1;
   10616              :         }
   10617              : 
   10618              :         if ((params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_CONF_FLAG_HT_OP_MODE) &&
   10619              :             nla_put_u16(msg, NL80211_MESHCONF_HT_OPMODE, params->ht_opmode)) {
   10620              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR, "nl80211: Failed to set HT_OP_MODE");
   10621              :                 return -1;
   10622              :         }
   10623              : 
   10624              :         nla_nest_end(msg, container);
   10625              : 
   10626              :         return 0;
   10627              : }
   10628              : 
   10629              : 
   10630              : static int nl80211_join_mesh(struct i802_bss *bss,
   10631              :                              struct wpa_driver_mesh_join_params *params)
   10632              : {
   10633              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   10634              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   10635              :         struct nlattr *container;
   10636              :         int ret = -1;
   10637              : 
   10638              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: mesh join (ifindex=%d)", drv->ifindex);
   10639              :         msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_JOIN_MESH);
   10640              :         if (!msg ||
   10641              :             nl80211_put_freq_params(msg, &params->freq) ||
   10642              :             nl80211_put_basic_rates(msg, params->basic_rates) ||
   10643              :             nl80211_put_mesh_id(msg, params->meshid, params->meshid_len) ||
   10644              :             nl80211_put_beacon_int(msg, params->beacon_int) ||
   10645              :             nl80211_put_dtim_period(msg, params->dtim_period))
   10646              :                 goto fail;
   10647              : 
   10648              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "  * flags=%08X", params->flags);
   10649              : 
   10650              :         if (params->handle_dfs && nla_put_flag(msg, NL80211_ATTR_HANDLE_DFS))
   10651              :                 goto fail;
   10652              : 
   10653              :         container = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_MESH_SETUP);
   10654              :         if (!container)
   10655              :                 goto fail;
   10656              : 
   10657              :         if (params->ies) {
   10658              :                 wpa_hexdump(MSG_DEBUG, "  * IEs", params->ies, params->ie_len);
   10659              :                 if (nla_put(msg, NL80211_MESH_SETUP_IE, params->ie_len,
   10660              :                             params->ies))
   10661              :                         goto fail;
   10662              :         }
   10663              :         /* WPA_DRIVER_MESH_FLAG_OPEN_AUTH is treated as default by nl80211 */
   10664              :         if (params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_FLAG_SAE_AUTH) {
   10665              :                 if (nla_put_u8(msg, NL80211_MESH_SETUP_AUTH_PROTOCOL, 0x1) ||
   10666              :                     nla_put_flag(msg, NL80211_MESH_SETUP_USERSPACE_AUTH))
   10667              :                         goto fail;
   10668              :         }
   10669              :         if ((params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_FLAG_AMPE) &&
   10670              :             nla_put_flag(msg, NL80211_MESH_SETUP_USERSPACE_AMPE))
   10671              :                 goto fail;
   10672              :         if ((params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_FLAG_USER_MPM) &&
   10673              :             nla_put_flag(msg, NL80211_MESH_SETUP_USERSPACE_MPM))
   10674              :                 goto fail;
   10675              :         nla_nest_end(msg, container);
   10676              : 
   10677              :         params->conf.flags |= WPA_DRIVER_MESH_CONF_FLAG_AUTO_PLINKS;
   10678              :         params->conf.flags |= WPA_DRIVER_MESH_CONF_FLAG_PEER_LINK_TIMEOUT;
   10679              :         params->conf.flags |= WPA_DRIVER_MESH_CONF_FLAG_MAX_PEER_LINKS;
   10680              :         if (nl80211_put_mesh_config(msg, &params->conf) < 0)
   10681              :                 goto fail;
   10682              : 
   10683              :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs_connect_handle(drv, msg, bss, 1);
   10684              :         msg = NULL;
   10685              :         if (ret) {
   10686              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: mesh join failed: ret=%d (%s)",
   10687              :                            ret, strerror(-ret));
   10688              :                 goto fail;
   10689              :         }
   10690              :         ret = 0;
   10691              :         drv->assoc_freq = bss->freq = params->freq.freq;
   10692              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: mesh join request send successfully");
   10693              : 
   10694              : fail:
   10695              :         nlmsg_free(msg);
   10696              :         return ret;
   10697              : }
   10698              : 
   10699              : 
   10700              : static int
   10701              : wpa_driver_nl80211_join_mesh(void *priv,
   10702              :                              struct wpa_driver_mesh_join_params *params)
   10703              : {
   10704              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   10705              :         int ret, timeout;
   10706              : 
   10707              :         timeout = params->conf.peer_link_timeout;
   10708              : 
   10709              :         /* Disable kernel inactivity timer */
   10710              :         if (params->flags & WPA_DRIVER_MESH_FLAG_USER_MPM)
   10711              :                 params->conf.peer_link_timeout = 0;
   10712              : 
   10713              :         ret = nl80211_join_mesh(bss, params);
   10714              :         if (ret == -EINVAL && params->conf.peer_link_timeout == 0) {
   10715              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   10716              :                            "nl80211: Mesh join retry for peer_link_timeout");
   10717              :                 /*
   10718              :                  * Old kernel does not support setting
   10719              :                  * NL80211_MESHCONF_PLINK_TIMEOUT to zero, so set 60 seconds
   10720              :                  * into future from peer_link_timeout.
   10721              :                  */
   10722              :                 params->conf.peer_link_timeout = timeout + 60;
   10723              :                 ret = nl80211_join_mesh(priv, params);
   10724              :         }
   10725              : 
   10726              :         params->conf.peer_link_timeout = timeout;
   10727              :         return ret;
   10728              : }
   10729              : 
   10730              : 
   10731              : static int wpa_driver_nl80211_leave_mesh(void *priv)

   10791              : 
   10792            0 : static int wpa_driver_br_add_ip_neigh(void *priv, u8 version,
   10793              :                                       const u8 *ipaddr, int prefixlen,
   10794              :                                       const u8 *addr)
   10795              : {
   10796              : #ifdef CONFIG_LIBNL3_ROUTE
   10797              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   10798              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   10799              :         struct rtnl_neigh *rn;
   10800              :         struct nl_addr *nl_ipaddr = NULL;
   10801              :         struct nl_addr *nl_lladdr = NULL;
   10802              :         int family, addrsize;
   10803              :         int res;
   10804              : 
   10805              :         if (!ipaddr || prefixlen == 0 || !addr)
   10806              :                 return -EINVAL;
   10807              : 
   10808              :         if (bss->br_ifindex == 0) {
   10809              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   10810              :                            "nl80211: bridge must be set before adding an ip neigh to it");
   10811              :                 return -1;
   10812              :         }
   10813              : 
   10814              :         if (!drv->rtnl_sk) {
   10815              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   10816              :                            "nl80211: nl_sock for NETLINK_ROUTE is not initialized");
   10817              :                 return -1;
   10818              :         }
   10819              : 
   10820              :         if (version == 4) {
   10821              :                 family = AF_INET;
   10822              :                 addrsize = 4;
   10823              :         } else if (version == 6) {
   10824              :                 family = AF_INET6;
   10825              :                 addrsize = 16;
   10826              :         } else {
   10827              :                 return -EINVAL;
   10828              :         }
   10829              : 
   10830              :         rn = rtnl_neigh_alloc();
   10831              :         if (rn == NULL)
   10832              :                 return -ENOMEM;
   10833              : 
   10834              :         /* set the destination ip address for neigh */
   10835              :         nl_ipaddr = nl_addr_build(family, (void *) ipaddr, addrsize);
   10836              :         if (nl_ipaddr == NULL) {
   10837              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: nl_ipaddr build failed");
   10838              :                 res = -ENOMEM;
   10839              :                 goto errout;
   10840              :         }
   10841              :         nl_addr_set_prefixlen(nl_ipaddr, prefixlen);
   10842              :         res = rtnl_neigh_set_dst(rn, nl_ipaddr);
   10843              :         if (res) {
   10844              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   10845              :                            "nl80211: neigh set destination addr failed");
   10846              :                 goto errout;
   10847              :         }
   10848              : 
   10849              :         /* set the corresponding lladdr for neigh */
   10850              :         nl_lladdr = nl_addr_build(AF_BRIDGE, (u8 *) addr, ETH_ALEN);
   10851              :         if (nl_lladdr == NULL) {
   10852              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: neigh set lladdr failed");
   10853              :                 res = -ENOMEM;
   10854              :                 goto errout;
   10855              :         }
   10856              :         rtnl_neigh_set_lladdr(rn, nl_lladdr);
   10857              : 
   10858              :         rtnl_neigh_set_ifindex(rn, bss->br_ifindex);
   10859              :         rtnl_neigh_set_state(rn, NUD_PERMANENT);
   10860              : 
   10861              :         res = rtnl_neigh_add(drv->rtnl_sk, rn, NLM_F_CREATE);
   10862              :         if (res) {
   10863              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   10864              :                            "nl80211: Adding bridge ip neigh failed: %s",
   10865              :                            nl_geterror(res));
   10866              :         }
   10867              : errout:
   10868              :         if (nl_lladdr)
   10869              :                 nl_addr_put(nl_lladdr);
   10870              :         if (nl_ipaddr)
   10871              :                 nl_addr_put(nl_ipaddr);
   10872              :         if (rn)
   10873              :                 rtnl_neigh_put(rn);
   10874              :         return res;
   10875              : #else /* CONFIG_LIBNL3_ROUTE */
   10876            0 :         return -1;
   10877              : #endif /* CONFIG_LIBNL3_ROUTE */
   10878              : }
   10879              :

   10955            0 : static int linux_write_system_file(const char *path, unsigned int val)

   10958              :         int fd, len;

   10973            0 :                 return -1;
