   11064              : #ifdef CONFIG_DRIVER_NL80211_QCA
   11065              : 
   11066              : static int hw_mode_to_qca_acs(enum hostapd_hw_mode hw_mode)
   11067              : {
   11068              :         switch (hw_mode) {
   11069              :         case HOSTAPD_MODE_IEEE80211B:
   11070              :                 return QCA_ACS_MODE_IEEE80211B;
   11071              :         case HOSTAPD_MODE_IEEE80211G:
   11072              :                 return QCA_ACS_MODE_IEEE80211G;
   11073              :         case HOSTAPD_MODE_IEEE80211A:
   11074              :                 return QCA_ACS_MODE_IEEE80211A;
   11075              :         case HOSTAPD_MODE_IEEE80211AD:
   11076              :                 return QCA_ACS_MODE_IEEE80211AD;
   11077              :         case HOSTAPD_MODE_IEEE80211ANY:
   11078              :                 return QCA_ACS_MODE_IEEE80211ANY;
   11079              :         default:
   11080              :                 return -1;
   11081              :         }
   11082              : }
   11083              : 
   11084              : 
   11085              : static int add_acs_ch_list(struct nl_msg *msg, const int *freq_list)
   11086              : {
   11087              :         int num_channels = 0, num_freqs;
   11088              :         u8 *ch_list;
   11089              :         enum hostapd_hw_mode hw_mode;
   11090              :         int ret = 0;
   11091              :         int i;
   11092              : 
   11093              :         if (!freq_list)
   11094              :                 return 0;
   11095              : 
   11096              :         num_freqs = int_array_len(freq_list);
   11097              :         ch_list = os_malloc(sizeof(u8) * num_freqs);
   11098              :         if (!ch_list)
   11099              :                 return -1;
   11100              : 
   11101              :         for (i = 0; i < num_freqs; i++) {
   11102              :                 const int freq = freq_list[i];
   11103              : 
   11104              :                 if (freq == 0)
   11105              :                         break;
   11106              :                 /* Send 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz channels with
   11107              :                  * QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_CH_LIST to maintain backwards
   11108              :                  * compatibility.
   11109              :                  */
   11110              :                 if (!(freq >= 2412 && freq <= 2484) &&
   11111              :                     !(freq >= 5180 && freq <= 5900) &&
   11112              :                     !(freq >= 5945 && freq <= 7115))
   11113              :                         continue;
   11114              :                 hw_mode = ieee80211_freq_to_chan(freq, &ch_list[num_channels]);
   11115              :                 if (hw_mode != NUM_HOSTAPD_MODES)
   11116              :                         num_channels++;
   11117              :         }
   11118              : 
   11119              :         if (num_channels)
   11120              :                 ret = nla_put(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_CH_LIST,
   11121              :                               num_channels, ch_list);
   11122              : 
   11123              :         os_free(ch_list);
   11124              :         return ret;
   11125              : }
   11126              : 
   11127              : 
   11128              : static int add_acs_freq_list(struct nl_msg *msg, const int *freq_list)
   11129              : {
   11130              :         int i, len, ret;
   11131              :         u32 *freqs;
   11132              : 
   11133              :         if (!freq_list)
   11134              :                 return 0;
   11135              :         len = int_array_len(freq_list);
   11136              :         freqs = os_malloc(sizeof(u32) * len);
   11137              :         if (!freqs)
   11138              :                 return -1;
   11139              :         for (i = 0; i < len; i++)
   11140              :                 freqs[i] = freq_list[i];
   11141              :         ret = nla_put(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_FREQ_LIST,
   11142              :                       sizeof(u32) * len, freqs);
   11143              :         os_free(freqs);
   11144              :         return ret;
   11145              : }
   11146              : 
   11147              : 
   11148              : static int nl80211_qca_do_acs(struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv,
   11149              :                               struct drv_acs_params *params)
   11150              : {
   11151              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   11152              :         struct nlattr *data;
   11153              :         int ret;
   11154              :         int mode;
   11155              : 
   11156              :         mode = hw_mode_to_qca_acs(params->hw_mode);
   11157              :         if (mode < 0)
   11158              :                 return -1;
   11159              : 
   11160              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_VENDOR)) ||
   11161              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_ID, OUI_QCA) ||
   11162              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_SUBCMD,
   11163              :                         QCA_NL80211_VENDOR_SUBCMD_DO_ACS) ||
   11164              :             !(data = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA)) ||
   11165              :             nla_put_u8(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_HW_MODE, mode) ||
   11166              :             (params->ht_enabled &&
   11167              :              nla_put_flag(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_HT_ENABLED)) ||
   11168              :             (params->ht40_enabled &&
   11169              :              nla_put_flag(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_HT40_ENABLED)) ||
   11170              :             (params->vht_enabled &&
   11171              :              nla_put_flag(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_VHT_ENABLED)) ||
   11172              :             (params->eht_enabled &&
   11173              :              nla_put_flag(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_EHT_ENABLED)) ||
   11174              :             nla_put_u16(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_CHWIDTH,
   11175              :                         params->ch_width) ||
   11176              :             add_acs_ch_list(msg, params->freq_list) ||
   11177              :             add_acs_freq_list(msg, params->freq_list) ||
   11178              :             (params->edmg_enabled &&
   11179              :              nla_put_flag(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_ACS_EDMG_ENABLED))) {
   11180              :                 nlmsg_free(msg);
   11181              :                 return -ENOBUFS;
   11182              :         }
   11183              :         nla_nest_end(msg, data);
   11184              : 
   11185              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11186              :                    "nl80211: ACS Params: HW_MODE: %d HT: %d HT40: %d VHT: %d EHT: %d BW: %d EDMG: %d",
   11187              :                    params->hw_mode, params->ht_enabled, params->ht40_enabled,
   11188              :                    params->vht_enabled, params->eht_enabled, params->ch_width,
   11189              :                    params->edmg_enabled);
   11190              : 
   11191              :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
   11192              :         if (ret) {
   11193              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11194              :                            "nl80211: Failed to invoke driver ACS function: %s",
   11195              :                            strerror(-ret));
   11196              :         }
   11197              :         return ret;
   11198              : }
   11199              : 
   11200              : 
   11201              : static int nl80211_set_band(void *priv, u32 band_mask)
   11202              : {
   11203              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   11204              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   11205              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   11206              :         struct nlattr *data;
   11207              :         int ret;
   11208              :         enum qca_set_band qca_band_value;
   11209              :         u32 qca_band_mask = QCA_SETBAND_AUTO;
   11210              : 
   11211              :         if (!drv->setband_vendor_cmd_avail ||
   11212              :             (band_mask > (WPA_SETBAND_2G | WPA_SETBAND_5G | WPA_SETBAND_6G)))
   11213              :                 return -1;
   11214              : 
   11215              :         if (band_mask & WPA_SETBAND_5G)
   11216              :                 qca_band_mask |= QCA_SETBAND_5G;
   11217              :         if (band_mask & WPA_SETBAND_2G)
   11218              :                 qca_band_mask |= QCA_SETBAND_2G;
   11219              :         if (band_mask & WPA_SETBAND_6G)
   11220              :                 qca_band_mask |= QCA_SETBAND_6G;
   11221              : 
   11222              :         /*
   11223              :          * QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_SETBAND_VALUE is a legacy interface hence make
   11224              :          * it suite to its values (AUTO/5G/2G) for backwards compatibility.
   11225              :          */
   11226              :         qca_band_value = ((qca_band_mask & QCA_SETBAND_5G) &&
   11227              :                           (qca_band_mask & QCA_SETBAND_2G)) ?
   11228              :                                 QCA_SETBAND_AUTO :
   11229              :                                 qca_band_mask & ~QCA_SETBAND_6G;
   11230              : 
   11231              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11232              :                    "nl80211: QCA_BAND_MASK = 0x%x, QCA_BAND_VALUE = %d",
   11233              :                    qca_band_mask, qca_band_value);
   11234              : 
   11235              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_VENDOR)) ||
   11236              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_ID, OUI_QCA) ||
   11237              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_SUBCMD,
   11238              :                         QCA_NL80211_VENDOR_SUBCMD_SETBAND) ||
   11239              :             !(data = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA)) ||
   11240              :             nla_put_u32(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_SETBAND_VALUE,
   11241              :                         qca_band_value) ||
   11242              :             nla_put_u32(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_SETBAND_MASK,
   11243              :                         qca_band_mask)) {
   11244              :                 nlmsg_free(msg);
   11245              :                 return -ENOBUFS;
   11246              :         }
   11247              :         nla_nest_end(msg, data);
   11248              : 
   11249              :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
   11250              :         if (ret) {
   11251              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11252              :                            "nl80211: Driver setband function failed: %s",
   11253              :                            strerror(-ret));
   11254              :         }
   11255              :         return ret;
   11256              : }
   11257              : 
   11258              : 
   11259              : struct nl80211_pcl {
   11260              :         unsigned int num;
   11261              :         unsigned int *freq_list;
   11262              : };
   11263              : 
   11264              : static int preferred_freq_info_handler(struct nl_msg *msg, void *arg)
   11265              : {
   11266              :         struct nlattr *tb[NL80211_ATTR_MAX + 1];
   11267              :         struct genlmsghdr *gnlh = nlmsg_data(nlmsg_hdr(msg));
   11268              :         struct nl80211_pcl *param = arg;
   11269              :         struct nlattr *nl_vend, *attr;
   11270              :         enum qca_iface_type iface_type;
   11271              :         struct nlattr *tb_vendor[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_MAX + 1];
   11272              :         unsigned int num, max_num;
   11273              :         u32 *freqs;
   11274              : 
   11275              :         nla_parse(tb, NL80211_ATTR_MAX, genlmsg_attrdata(gnlh, 0),
   11276              :                   genlmsg_attrlen(gnlh, 0), NULL);
   11277              : 
   11278              :         nl_vend = tb[NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA];
   11279              :         if (!nl_vend)
   11280              :                 return NL_SKIP;
   11281              : 
   11282              :         nla_parse(tb_vendor, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_MAX,
   11283              :                   nla_data(nl_vend), nla_len(nl_vend), NULL);
   11284              : 
   11285              :         attr = tb_vendor[
   11286              :                 QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_GET_PREFERRED_FREQ_LIST_IFACE_TYPE];
   11287              :         if (!attr) {
   11288              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR, "nl80211: iface_type couldn't be found");
   11289              :                 param->num = 0;
   11290              :                 return NL_SKIP;
   11291              :         }
   11292              : 
   11293              :         iface_type = (enum qca_iface_type) nla_get_u32(attr);
   11294              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: Driver returned iface_type=%d",
   11295              :                    iface_type);
   11296              : 
   11297              :         attr = tb_vendor[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_GET_PREFERRED_FREQ_LIST];
   11298              :         if (!attr) {
   11299              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR,
   11300              :                            "nl80211: preferred_freq_list couldn't be found");
   11301              :                 param->num = 0;
   11302              :                 return NL_SKIP;
   11303              :         }
   11304              : 
   11305              :         /*
   11306              :          * param->num has the maximum number of entries for which there
   11307              :          * is room in the freq_list provided by the caller.
   11308              :          */
   11309              :         freqs = nla_data(attr);
   11310              :         max_num = nla_len(attr) / sizeof(u32);
   11311              :         if (max_num > param->num)
   11312              :                 max_num = param->num;
   11313              :         for (num = 0; num < max_num; num++)
   11314              :                 param->freq_list[num] = freqs[num];
   11315              :         param->num = num;
   11316              : 
   11317              :         return NL_SKIP;
   11318              : }
   11319              : 
   11320              : 
   11321              : static int nl80211_get_pref_freq_list(void *priv,
   11322              :                                       enum wpa_driver_if_type if_type,
   11323              :                                       unsigned int *num,
   11324              :                                       unsigned int *freq_list)
   11325              : {
   11326              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   11327              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   11328              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   11329              :         int ret;
   11330              :         unsigned int i;
   11331              :         struct nlattr *params;
   11332              :         struct nl80211_pcl param;
   11333              :         enum qca_iface_type iface_type;
   11334              : 
   11335              :         if (!drv->get_pref_freq_list)
   11336              :                 return -1;
   11337              : 
   11338              :         switch (if_type) {
   11339              :         case WPA_IF_STATION:
   11340              :                 iface_type = QCA_IFACE_TYPE_STA;
   11341              :                 break;
   11342              :         case WPA_IF_AP_BSS:
   11343              :                 iface_type = QCA_IFACE_TYPE_AP;
   11344              :                 break;
   11345              :         case WPA_IF_P2P_GO:
   11346              :                 iface_type = QCA_IFACE_TYPE_P2P_GO;
   11347              :                 break;
   11348              :         case WPA_IF_P2P_CLIENT:
   11349              :                 iface_type = QCA_IFACE_TYPE_P2P_CLIENT;
   11350              :                 break;
   11351              :         case WPA_IF_IBSS:
   11352              :                 iface_type = QCA_IFACE_TYPE_IBSS;
   11353              :                 break;
   11354              :         case WPA_IF_TDLS:
   11355              :                 iface_type = QCA_IFACE_TYPE_TDLS;
   11356              :                 break;
   11357              :         default:
   11358              :                 return -1;
   11359              :         }
   11360              : 
   11361              :         param.num = *num;
   11362              :         param.freq_list = freq_list;
   11363              : 
   11364              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_VENDOR)) ||
   11365              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_IFINDEX, drv->ifindex) ||
   11366              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_ID, OUI_QCA) ||
   11367              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_SUBCMD,
   11368              :                         QCA_NL80211_VENDOR_SUBCMD_GET_PREFERRED_FREQ_LIST) ||
   11369              :             !(params = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA)) ||
   11370              :             nla_put_u32(msg,
   11371              :                         QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_GET_PREFERRED_FREQ_LIST_IFACE_TYPE,
   11372              :                         iface_type)) {
   11373              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR,
   11374              :                            "%s: err in adding vendor_cmd and vendor_data",
   11375              :                            __func__);
   11376              :                 nlmsg_free(msg);
   11377              :                 return -1;
   11378              :         }
   11379              :         nla_nest_end(msg, params);
   11380              : 
   11381              :         os_memset(freq_list, 0, *num * sizeof(freq_list[0]));
   11382              :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, preferred_freq_info_handler, &param,
   11383              :                                  NULL, NULL);
   11384              :         if (ret) {
   11385              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR,
   11386              :                            "%s: err in send_and_recv_msgs", __func__);
   11387              :                 return ret;
   11388              :         }
   11389              : 
   11390              :         *num = param.num;
   11391              : 
   11392              :         for (i = 0; i < *num; i++) {
   11393              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: preferred_channel_list[%d]=%d",
   11394              :                            i, freq_list[i]);
   11395              :         }
   11396              : 
   11397              :         return 0;
   11398              : }
   11399              : 
   11400              : 
   11401              : static int nl80211_set_prob_oper_freq(void *priv, unsigned int freq)
   11402              : {
   11403              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   11404              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   11405              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   11406              :         int ret;
   11407              :         struct nlattr *params;
   11408              : 
   11409              :         if (!drv->set_prob_oper_freq)
   11410              :                 return -1;
   11411              : 
   11412              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11413              :                    "nl80211: Set P2P probable operating freq %u for ifindex %d",
   11414              :                    freq, bss->ifindex);
   11415              : 
   11416              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_VENDOR)) ||
   11417              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_ID, OUI_QCA) ||
   11418              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_SUBCMD,
   11419              :                         QCA_NL80211_VENDOR_SUBCMD_SET_PROBABLE_OPER_CHANNEL) ||
   11420              :             !(params = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA)) ||
   11421              :             nla_put_u32(msg,
   11422              :                         QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_PROBABLE_OPER_CHANNEL_IFACE_TYPE,
   11423              :                         QCA_IFACE_TYPE_P2P_CLIENT) ||
   11424              :             nla_put_u32(msg,
   11425              :                         QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_PROBABLE_OPER_CHANNEL_FREQ,
   11426              :                         freq)) {
   11427              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR,
   11428              :                            "%s: err in adding vendor_cmd and vendor_data",
   11429              :                            __func__);
   11430              :                 nlmsg_free(msg);
   11431              :                 return -1;
   11432              :         }
   11433              :         nla_nest_end(msg, params);
   11434              : 
   11435              :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
   11436              :         msg = NULL;
   11437              :         if (ret) {
   11438              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR, "%s: err in send_and_recv_msgs",
   11439              :                            __func__);
   11440              :                 return ret;
   11441              :         }
   11442              :         nlmsg_free(msg);
   11443              :         return 0;
   11444              : }
   11445              : 
   11446              : 
   11447              : static int nl80211_p2p_lo_start(void *priv, unsigned int freq,
   11448              :                                 unsigned int period, unsigned int interval,
   11449              :                                 unsigned int count, const u8 *device_types,
   11450              :                                 size_t dev_types_len,
   11451              :                                 const u8 *ies, size_t ies_len)
   11452              : {
   11453              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   11454              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   11455              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   11456              :         struct nlattr *container;
   11457              :         int ret;
   11458              : 
   11459              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11460              :                    "nl80211: Start P2P Listen offload: freq=%u, period=%u, interval=%u, count=%u",
   11461              :                    freq, period, interval, count);
   11462              : 
   11463              :         if (!(drv->capa.flags & WPA_DRIVER_FLAGS_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD))
   11464              :                 return -1;
   11465              : 
   11466              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_VENDOR)) ||
   11467              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_ID, OUI_QCA) ||
   11468              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_SUBCMD,
   11469              :                         QCA_NL80211_VENDOR_SUBCMD_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD_START))
   11470              :                 goto fail;
   11471              : 
   11472              :         container = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA);
   11473              :         if (!container)
   11474              :                 goto fail;
   11475              : 
   11476              :         if (nla_put_u32(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD_CHANNEL,
   11477              :                         freq) ||
   11478              :             nla_put_u32(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD_PERIOD,
   11479              :                         period) ||
   11480              :             nla_put_u32(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD_INTERVAL,
   11481              :                         interval) ||
   11482              :             nla_put_u32(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD_COUNT,
   11483              :                         count) ||
   11484              :             nla_put(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD_DEVICE_TYPES,
   11485              :                     dev_types_len, device_types) ||
   11486              :             nla_put(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD_VENDOR_IE,
   11487              :                     ies_len, ies))
   11488              :                 goto fail;
   11489              : 
   11490              :         nla_nest_end(msg, container);
   11491              :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
   11492              :         msg = NULL;
   11493              :         if (ret) {
   11494              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11495              :                            "nl80211: Failed to send P2P Listen offload vendor command");
   11496              :                 goto fail;
   11497              :         }
   11498              : 
   11499              :         return 0;
   11500              : 
   11501              : fail:
   11502              :         nlmsg_free(msg);
   11503              :         return -1;
   11504              : }
   11505              : 
   11506              : 
   11507              : static int nl80211_p2p_lo_stop(void *priv)
   11508              : {
   11509              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   11510              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   11511              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   11512              : 
   11513              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: Stop P2P Listen offload");
   11514              : 
   11515              :         if (!(drv->capa.flags & WPA_DRIVER_FLAGS_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD))
   11516              :                 return -1;
   11517              : 
   11518              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_VENDOR)) ||
   11519              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_ID, OUI_QCA) ||
   11520              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_SUBCMD,
   11521              :                         QCA_NL80211_VENDOR_SUBCMD_P2P_LISTEN_OFFLOAD_STOP)) {
   11522              :                 nlmsg_free(msg);
   11523              :                 return -1;
   11524              :         }
   11525              : 
   11526              :         return send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
   11527              : }
   11528              : 
   11529              : 
   11530              : static int nl80211_set_tdls_mode(void *priv, int tdls_external_control)
   11531              : {
   11532              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   11533              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   11534              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   11535              :         struct nlattr *params;
   11536              :         int ret;
   11537              :         u32 tdls_mode;
   11538              : 
   11539              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11540              :                    "nl80211: Set TDKS mode: tdls_external_control=%d",
   11541              :                    tdls_external_control);
   11542              : 
   11543              :         if (tdls_external_control == 1)
   11544              :                 tdls_mode = QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_TDLS_TRIGGER_MODE_IMPLICIT |
   11545              :                         QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_TDLS_TRIGGER_MODE_EXTERNAL;
   11546              :         else
   11547              :                 tdls_mode = QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_TDLS_TRIGGER_MODE_EXPLICIT;
   11548              : 
   11549              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_VENDOR)) ||
   11550              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_ID, OUI_QCA) ||
   11551              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_SUBCMD,
   11552              :                         QCA_NL80211_VENDOR_SUBCMD_CONFIGURE_TDLS))
   11553              :                 goto fail;
   11554              : 
   11555              :         params = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA);
   11556              :         if (!params)
   11557              :                 goto fail;
   11558              : 
   11559              :         if (nla_put_u32(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_TDLS_CONFIG_TRIGGER_MODE,
   11560              :                         tdls_mode))
   11561              :                 goto fail;
   11562              : 
   11563              :         nla_nest_end(msg, params);
   11564              : 
   11565              :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
   11566              :         msg = NULL;
   11567              :         if (ret) {
   11568              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR,
   11569              :                            "nl80211: Set TDLS mode failed: ret=%d (%s)",
   11570              :                            ret, strerror(-ret));
   11571              :                 goto fail;
   11572              :         }
   11573              :         return 0;
   11574              : fail:
   11575              :         nlmsg_free(msg);
   11576              :         return -1;
   11577              : }
   11578              : 
   11579              : 
   11580              : #ifdef CONFIG_MBO
   11581              : 
   11582              : static enum mbo_transition_reject_reason
   11583              : nl80211_mbo_reject_reason_mapping(enum qca_wlan_btm_candidate_status status)
   11584              : {
   11585              :         switch (status) {
   11586              :         case QCA_STATUS_REJECT_EXCESSIVE_FRAME_LOSS_EXPECTED:
   11587              :                 return MBO_TRANSITION_REJECT_REASON_FRAME_LOSS;
   11588              :         case QCA_STATUS_REJECT_EXCESSIVE_DELAY_EXPECTED:
   11589              :                 return MBO_TRANSITION_REJECT_REASON_DELAY;
   11590              :         case QCA_STATUS_REJECT_INSUFFICIENT_QOS_CAPACITY:
   11591              :                 return MBO_TRANSITION_REJECT_REASON_QOS_CAPACITY;
   11592              :         case QCA_STATUS_REJECT_LOW_RSSI:
   11593              :                 return MBO_TRANSITION_REJECT_REASON_RSSI;
   11594              :         case QCA_STATUS_REJECT_HIGH_INTERFERENCE:
   11595              :                 return MBO_TRANSITION_REJECT_REASON_INTERFERENCE;
   11596              :         case QCA_STATUS_REJECT_UNKNOWN:
   11597              :         default:
   11598              :                 return MBO_TRANSITION_REJECT_REASON_UNSPECIFIED;
   11599              :         }
   11600              : }
   11601              : 
   11602              : 
   11603              : static void nl80211_parse_btm_candidate_info(struct candidate_list *candidate,
   11604              :                                              struct nlattr *tb[], int num)
   11605              : {
   11606              :         enum qca_wlan_btm_candidate_status status;
   11607              :         char buf[50];
   11608              : 
   11609              :         os_memcpy(candidate->bssid,
   11610              :                   nla_data(tb[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_BSSID]),
   11611              :                   ETH_ALEN);
   11612              : 
   11613              :         status = nla_get_u32(
   11614              :                 tb[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_STATUS]);
   11615              :         candidate->is_accept = status == QCA_STATUS_ACCEPT;
   11616              :         candidate->reject_reason = nl80211_mbo_reject_reason_mapping(status);
   11617              : 
   11618              :         if (candidate->is_accept)
   11619              :                 os_snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "Accepted");
   11620              :         else
   11621              :                 os_snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf),
   11622              :                             "Rejected, Reject_reason: %d",
   11623              :                             candidate->reject_reason);
   11624              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211:   BSSID[%d]: " MACSTR " %s",
   11625              :                    num, MAC2STR(candidate->bssid), buf);
   11626              : }
   11627              : 
   11628              : 
   11629              : static int
   11630              : nl80211_get_bss_transition_status_handler(struct nl_msg *msg, void *arg)
   11631              : {
   11632              :         struct wpa_bss_candidate_info *info = arg;
   11633              :         struct candidate_list *candidate = info->candidates;
   11634              :         struct nlattr *tb_msg[NL80211_ATTR_MAX + 1];
   11635              :         struct nlattr *tb_vendor[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_MAX + 1];
   11636              :         struct nlattr *tb[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_MAX + 1];
   11637              :         static struct nla_policy policy[
   11638              :                 QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_MAX + 1] = {
   11639              :                 [QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_BSSID] = {
   11640              :                         .minlen = ETH_ALEN
   11641              :                 },
   11642              :                 [QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_STATUS] = {
   11643              :                         .type = NLA_U32,
   11644              :                 },
   11645              :         };
   11646              :         struct nlattr *attr;
   11647              :         int rem;
   11648              :         struct genlmsghdr *gnlh = nlmsg_data(nlmsg_hdr(msg));
   11649              :         u8 num;
   11650              : 
   11651              :         num = info->num; /* number of candidates sent to driver */
   11652              :         info->num = 0;
   11653              :         nla_parse(tb_msg, NL80211_ATTR_MAX, genlmsg_attrdata(gnlh, 0),
   11654              :                   genlmsg_attrlen(gnlh, 0), NULL);
   11655              : 
   11656              :         if (!tb_msg[NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA] ||
   11657              :             nla_parse_nested(tb_vendor, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_MAX,
   11658              :                              tb_msg[NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA], NULL) ||
   11659              :             !tb_vendor[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO])
   11660              :                 return NL_SKIP;
   11661              : 
   11662              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11663              :                    "nl80211: WNM Candidate list received from driver");
   11664              :         nla_for_each_nested(attr,
   11665              :                             tb_vendor[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO],
   11666              :                             rem) {
   11667              :                 if (info->num >= num ||
   11668              :                     nla_parse_nested(
   11669              :                             tb, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_MAX,
   11670              :                             attr, policy) ||
   11671              :                     !tb[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_BSSID] ||
   11672              :                     !tb[QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_STATUS])
   11673              :                         break;
   11674              : 
   11675              :                 nl80211_parse_btm_candidate_info(candidate, tb, info->num);
   11676              : 
   11677              :                 candidate++;
   11678              :                 info->num++;
   11679              :         }
   11680              : 
   11681              :         return NL_SKIP;
   11682              : }
   11683              : 
   11684              : 
   11685              : static struct wpa_bss_candidate_info *
   11686              : nl80211_get_bss_transition_status(void *priv, struct wpa_bss_trans_info *params)
   11687              : {
   11688              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   11689              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   11690              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   11691              :         struct nlattr *attr, *attr1, *attr2;
   11692              :         struct wpa_bss_candidate_info *info;
   11693              :         u8 i;
   11694              :         int ret;
   11695              :         u8 *pos;
   11696              : 
   11697              :         if (!drv->fetch_bss_trans_status)
   11698              :                 return NULL;
   11699              : 
   11700              :         info = os_zalloc(sizeof(*info));
   11701              :         if (!info)
   11702              :                 return NULL;
   11703              :         /* Allocate memory for number of candidates sent to driver */
   11704              :         info->candidates = os_calloc(params->n_candidates,
   11705              :                                      sizeof(*info->candidates));
   11706              :         if (!info->candidates) {
   11707              :                 os_free(info);
   11708              :                 return NULL;
   11709              :         }
   11710              : 
   11711              :         /* Copy the number of candidates being sent to driver. This is used in
   11712              :          * nl80211_get_bss_transition_status_handler() to limit the number of
   11713              :          * candidates that can be populated in info->candidates and will be
   11714              :          * later overwritten with the actual number of candidates received from
   11715              :          * the driver.
   11716              :          */
   11717              :         info->num = params->n_candidates;
   11718              : 
   11719              :         if (!(msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_VENDOR)) ||
   11720              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_ID, OUI_QCA) ||
   11721              :             nla_put_u32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_SUBCMD,
   11722              :                         QCA_NL80211_VENDOR_SUBCMD_FETCH_BSS_TRANSITION_STATUS))
   11723              :                 goto fail;
   11724              : 
   11725              :         attr = nla_nest_start(msg, NL80211_ATTR_VENDOR_DATA);
   11726              :         if (!attr)
   11727              :                 goto fail;
   11728              : 
   11729              :         if (nla_put_u8(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_MBO_TRANSITION_REASON,
   11730              :                        params->mbo_transition_reason))
   11731              :                 goto fail;
   11732              : 
   11733              :         attr1 = nla_nest_start(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO);
   11734              :         if (!attr1)
   11735              :                 goto fail;
   11736              : 
   11737              :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   11738              :                    "nl80211: WNM Candidate list info sending to driver: mbo_transition_reason: %d n_candidates: %d",
   11739              :                    params->mbo_transition_reason, params->n_candidates);
   11740              :         pos = params->bssid;
   11741              :         for (i = 0; i < params->n_candidates; i++) {
   11742              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211:   BSSID[%d]: " MACSTR, i,
   11743              :                            MAC2STR(pos));
   11744              :                 attr2 = nla_nest_start(msg, i);
   11745              :                 if (!attr2 ||
   11746              :                     nla_put(msg, QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_BTM_CANDIDATE_INFO_BSSID,
   11747              :                             ETH_ALEN, pos))
   11748              :                         goto fail;
   11749              :                 pos += ETH_ALEN;
   11750              :                 nla_nest_end(msg, attr2);
   11751              :         }
   11752              : 
   11753              :         nla_nest_end(msg, attr1);
   11754              :         nla_nest_end(msg, attr);
   11755              : 
   11756              :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg,
   11757              :                                  nl80211_get_bss_transition_status_handler,
   11758              :                                  info, NULL, NULL);
   11759              :         msg = NULL;
   11760              :         if (ret) {
   11761              :                 wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR,
   11762              :                            "nl80211: WNM Get BSS transition status failed: ret=%d (%s)",
   11763              :                            ret, strerror(-ret));
   11764              :                 goto fail;
   11765              :         }
   11766              :         return info;

   11775              : 
   11776              : /**
   11777              :  * nl80211_ignore_assoc_disallow - Configure driver to ignore assoc_disallow

   11904            0 : static int nl80211_write_to_file(const char *name, unsigned int val)
   11905              : {

   11907              :         char tmp[128];

   11912              :                 int level;

   11914              :                  * Flags may not exist on older kernels, or while we're tearing
   11915              :                  * down a disappearing device.
   11916              :                  */
   11917            0 :                 if (errno == ENOENT) {
   11918            0 :                         ret = 0;
   11919            0 :                         level = MSG_DEBUG;
   11920              :                 } else {
   11921            0 :                         ret = -1;
   11922            0 :                         level = MSG_ERROR;
   11923              :                 }

   11925            0 :                            name, strerror(errno));
   11926            0 :                 return ret;
   11927              :         }

   11932            0 :                 ret = -1;

   12047            0 : static int nl80211_update_connection_params(

   12050              : {
   12051            0 :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;

   12058              :          * internal SME and expect these updated connection params from

   12060              :          * SME from wpa_supplicant.

   12062            0 :         if (drv->capa.flags & WPA_DRIVER_FLAGS_SME)

   12074            0 :                             params->wpa_ie))
   12075            0 :                         goto fail;

   12077              :                             params->wpa_ie_len);
   12078              :         }

   12104              : 
   12105           98 : static int nl80211_send_external_auth_status(void *priv,
   12106              :                                              struct external_auth *params)
   12107              : {
   12108           98 :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   12109           98 :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   12110           98 :         struct nl_msg *msg = NULL;
   12111           98 :         int ret = -1;
   12112              : 
   12113              :         /* External auth command/status is intended for drivers that implement
   12114              :          * internal SME but want to offload authentication processing (e.g.,
   12115              :          * SAE) to hostapd/wpa_supplicant. Do not send the status to drivers
   12116              :          * which do not support AP SME or use wpa_supplicant/hostapd SME.
   12117              :          */
   12118           98 :         if ((is_ap_interface(drv->nlmode) && !bss->drv->device_ap_sme) ||
   12119            0 :             (drv->capa.flags & WPA_DRIVER_FLAGS_SME))
   12120           98 :                 return -1;
   12121              : 
   12122            0 :         wpa_dbg(drv->ctx, MSG_DEBUG,
   12123              :                 "nl80211: External auth status: %u", params->status);
   12124              : 
   12125            0 :         msg = nl80211_drv_msg(drv, 0, NL80211_CMD_EXTERNAL_AUTH);
   12126            0 :         if (!msg ||
   12127            0 :             nla_put_u16(msg, NL80211_ATTR_STATUS_CODE, params->status) ||
   12128            0 :             (params->ssid && params->ssid_len &&
   12129            0 :              nla_put(msg, NL80211_ATTR_SSID, params->ssid_len, params->ssid)) ||
   12130            0 :             (params->pmkid &&
   12131            0 :              nla_put(msg, NL80211_ATTR_PMKID, PMKID_LEN, params->pmkid)) ||
   12132            0 :             (params->bssid &&
   12133            0 :              nla_put(msg, NL80211_ATTR_BSSID, ETH_ALEN, params->bssid)))
   12134            0 :                 goto fail;
   12135            0 :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
   12136            0 :         msg = NULL;
   12137            0 :         if (ret) {
   12138            0 :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   12139              :                            "nl80211: External Auth status update failed: ret=%d (%s)",
   12140              :                            ret, strerror(-ret));
   12141            0 :                 goto fail;
   12142              :         }
   12143            0 : fail:
   12144            0 :         nlmsg_free(msg);
   12145            0 :         return ret;
   12146              : }
   12147              : 
   12148              : 
   12149            0 : static int nl80211_set_4addr_mode(void *priv, const char *bridge_ifname,
   12150              :                                   int val)
   12151              : {
   12152            0 :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   12153            0 :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   12154              :         struct nl_msg *msg;
   12155            0 :         int ret = -ENOBUFS;
   12156              : 
   12157            0 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG, "nl80211: %s 4addr mode (bridge_ifname: %s)",
   12158              :                    val ? "Enable" : "Disable", bridge_ifname);
   12159              : 
   12160            0 :         msg = nl80211_cmd_msg(drv->first_bss, 0, NL80211_CMD_SET_INTERFACE);
   12161            0 :         if (!msg || nla_put_u8(msg, NL80211_ATTR_4ADDR, val))
   12162            0 :                 goto fail;
   12163              : 
   12164            0 :         if (bridge_ifname[0] && bss->added_if_into_bridge && !val) {
   12165            0 :                 if (linux_br_del_if(drv->global->ioctl_sock,
   12166            0 :                                     bridge_ifname, bss->ifname)) {
   12167            0 :                         wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR,
   12168              :                                    "nl80211: Failed to remove interface %s from bridge %s",
   12169            0 :                                    bss->ifname, bridge_ifname);
   12170            0 :                         return -1;
   12171              :                 }
   12172            0 :                 bss->added_if_into_bridge = 0;
   12173              :         }
   12174              : 
   12175            0 :         ret = send_and_recv_msgs(drv, msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
   12176            0 :         msg = NULL;
   12177            0 :         if (ret && val && nl80211_get_4addr(bss) == 1) {
   12178            0 :                 wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   12179              :                            "nl80211: 4addr mode was already enabled");
   12180            0 :                 ret = 0;
   12181              :         }
   12182            0 :         if (!ret) {
   12183            0 :                 if (bridge_ifname[0] && val &&
   12184            0 :                     i802_check_bridge(drv, bss, bridge_ifname, bss->ifname) < 0)
   12185            0 :                         return -1;
   12186            0 :                 return 0;
   12187              :         }
   12188              : 
   12189            0 : fail:
   12190            0 :         nlmsg_free(msg);
   12191            0 :         wpa_printf(MSG_ERROR, "nl80211: Failed to enable/disable 4addr");
   12192              : 
   12193            0 :         return ret;
   12194              : }
   12195              : 
   12196              : 
   12197              : #ifdef CONFIG_DPP
   12198            0 : static int nl80211_dpp_listen(void *priv, bool enable)
   12199              : {
   12200            0 :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   12201            0 :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   12202            0 :         u16 type = (WLAN_FC_TYPE_MGMT << 2) | (WLAN_FC_STYPE_ACTION << 4);
   12203              :         struct nl_sock *handle;
   12204              : 
   12205            0 :         if (!drv->multicast_registrations || !bss->nl_mgmt)
   12206            0 :                 return 0; /* cannot do more than hope broadcast RX works */
   12207              : 
   12208            0 :         wpa_printf(MSG_DEBUG,
   12209              :                    "nl80211: Update DPP Public Action frame registration (%s multicast RX)",
   12210              :                    enable ? "enable" : "disable");
   12211            0 :         handle = (void *) (((intptr_t) bss->nl_mgmt) ^ ELOOP_SOCKET_INVALID);
   12212            0 :         return nl80211_register_frame(bss, handle, type,
   12213              :                                       (u8 *) "\x04\x09\x50\x6f\x9a\x1a", 6,
   12214              :                                       enable);
   12215              : }
   12216              : #endif /* CONFIG_DPP */

   12218              : 
   12219              : #ifdef CONFIG_TESTING_OPTIONS

   12221              : static int testing_nl80211_register_frame(void *priv, u16 type,
   12222              :                                           const u8 *match, size_t match_len,
   12223              :                                           bool multicast)
   12224              : {
   12225              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   12226              :         struct nl_sock *handle;
   12227              : 
   12228              :         if (!bss->nl_mgmt)
   12229              :                 return -1;

   12231              :         return nl80211_register_frame(bss, handle, type, match, match_len,
   12232              :                                       multicast);
   12233              : }

   12235              : 
   12236              : static int testing_nl80211_radio_disable(void *priv, int disabled)
   12237              : {
   12238              :         struct i802_bss *bss = priv;
   12239              :         struct wpa_driver_nl80211_data *drv = bss->drv;
   12240              : 
   12241              :         /* For now, this is supported only partially in station mode with
   12242              :          * SME-in-wpa_supplicant case where the NL80211_ATTR_LOCAL_STATE_CHANGE
   12243              :          * attribute can be used to avoid sending out the Deauthentication frame
   12244              :          * to the currently associated AP. */
   12245              : 
   12246              :         if (!disabled)
   12247              :                 return 0;
   12248              : 
   12249              :         if (!(drv->capa.flags & WPA_DRIVER_FLAGS_SME))
   12250              :                 return -1;
   12251              : 
   12252              :         if (!drv->associated)
   12253              :                 return 0;
   12254              : 
   12255              :         return wpa_driver_nl80211_mlme(drv, drv->bssid,
   12256              :                                        NL80211_CMD_DEAUTHENTICATE,
   12257              :                                        WLAN_REASON_PREV_AUTH_NOT_VALID, 1,
   12258              :                                        drv->first_bss);
   12259              : }
   12260              : 
   12261              : #endif /* CONFIG_TESTING_OPTIONS */
